title: How to Make a Cupcake Cone

steps.title: Preheat the oven to 350°F (177°C) and stand your ice cream cones up in a muffin tin.
steps.content: Preheat the oven to 350°F (177°C) and stand your ice cream cones up in a muffin tin. Each well gets one ice cream cone. If you cannot fit all of your ice cream cones into the muffin tin, set them aside; you can bake them in a separate batch. Some bakers recommend cutting holes into the bottom of an aluminum foil baking tin, turning the tin upside down, and sticking the cones into the holes. Use ice cream cones that have a flat bottom as opposed to the ones that are cone-shaped; they will stand up better.

steps.title: Mix together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
steps.content: Mix together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Pour the flour into a large mixing bowl, then add the baking powder and salt. Stir everything together to combine, then set aside. If the flour is lumpy, sift is before mixing with other ingredients.

steps.title: Cream the butter in a separate bowl.
steps.content: Cream the butter in a separate bowl. Cut the butter into small cubes first, then put it into a separate bowl. Beat the butter until it turns smooth using an electric mixer on low speed. This will take about 2 minutes. [1] X Research source You can use an electric stand mixer, a handheld better, or even a food processor to do this.

steps.title: Add the sugar a little bit at a time into the creamed butter.
steps.content: Add the sugar a little bit at a time into the creamed butter. Keep beating until the mixture is light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Be sure to scrape down the sides of the bowl often to ensure that everything mixes in together evenly. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Beat in the vanilla extract, then add the eggs one at a time, beating after each one.
steps.content: Beat in the vanilla extract, then add the eggs one at a time, beating after each one. Beat in the vanilla extract first. Next, add just one egg, and beat until combined. Add your second egg, and beat again. Make sure that there are no streaks of egg yolk left.

steps.title: Alternate between adding the flour mixture and the milk, mixing well after each addition.
steps.content: Alternate between adding the flour mixture and the milk, mixing well after each addition. Add one-fourth of the flour mixture into the creamed butter, and stir well. Pour in one-fourth of the milk, and stir again. Keep doing this until you have no more milk or flour left. [3] X Research source You can do this step with a rubber spatula or using the medium-low speed setting on your beater. Avoid overmixing your batter, stopping once everything is combined; otherwise, your as cupcakes could taste eggy and dense.

steps.title: Fill the cones ½ to ⅔ of the way with the batter.
steps.content: Fill the cones ½ to ⅔ of the way with the batter. [4] X Research source Each cone will take about 4 tablespoons (60 milliliters) of batter. [5] X Research source Don't fill them all the way; you need the extra space for expansion. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Bake the cones for about 18 minutes.
steps.content: Bake the cones for about 18 minutes. [7] X Research source They are ready when a toothpick poked into the center comes out clean. If you have any leftover cones and batter, fill them up with batter, and bake them for another 18 minutes or so.

steps.title: Allow the cupcake cones to cool completely.
steps.content: Allow the cupcake cones to cool completely. This is very important. If you frost them too soon, the frosting will melt.

steps.title: Beat the butter on medium speed for 6 minutes.
steps.content: Beat the butter on medium speed for 6 minutes. Cut the butter into small cubes first, then place it into a mixing bowl. Beat the butter on medium speed using an electric mixer until it turns light and fluffy, about 6 minutes.

steps.title: Add the sugar, vanilla extract, and salt, and mix again.
steps.content: Add the sugar, vanilla extract, and salt, and mix again. Beat everything together on low speed first to combine, and then on medium speed for 6 to 7 minutes, or until the frosting is light and fluffy.

steps.title: Use a large cookie scoop to drop the frosting onto the cupcakes.
steps.content: Use a large cookie scoop to drop the frosting onto the cupcakes. Press down on the scoop slightly to seal the frosting against the cupcake. This will make the cupcakes look even more like ice cream! [8] X Research source Alternatively, you could fit a piping bag fitted with a star-shaped decorator's tip with the frosting, and pipe the frosting onto the cupcake. Start the from the outer edge, and squeeze the bag harder as you reach the center. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Place the cupcakes into the fridge for 1 hour so that the frosting can set.
steps.content: Place the cupcakes into the fridge for 1 hour so that the frosting can set. To keep them from tipping over, place them all back into the muffin pan. Once the frosting has set, you can start preparing the chocolate ganache topping.

steps.title: Bring the heavy cream to a just below a boil in a small saucepan.
steps.content: Bring the heavy cream to a just below a boil in a small saucepan. Pour the heavy cream into a small saucepan, then place the saucepan on the stove. Set the heat to medium, and wait until the heavy cream comes just short of boiling.

steps.title: Pour the heavy cream over the chocolate chips.
steps.content: Pour the heavy cream over the chocolate chips. Place the chocolate chips into a heat-safe bowl, then pour the hot, heavy cream over them. You can use milk chocolate or semi-sweet chocolate chips for this.

steps.title: Cover the bowl with foil, and let it sit for 5 minutes.
steps.content: Cover the bowl with foil, and let it sit for 5 minutes. [10] X Research source During this time, the hot cream will melt the chocolate chips without scorching them. If you don't have any foil on hand, you can use a plate instead.

steps.title: Stir the chocolate chips and milk together with a whisk until combined.
steps.content: Stir the chocolate chips and milk together with a whisk until combined. Lift the foil away, and briskly whisk the two together until everything is smooth. Be sure to scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl often.

steps.title: Let the mixture sit until it cools and thickens.
steps.content: Let the mixture sit until it cools and thickens. If you piped the frosting on instead, you can skip this step and more on to the next; you'd want to use the ganache before it starts to thicken.

steps.title: Use a spoon to pour the ganache onto the frosting and swirl it around.
steps.content: Use a spoon to pour the ganache onto the frosting and swirl it around. If you piped the frosting on, pour the ganache on instead so that you don't ruin the piped texture.

steps.title: Top each cupcake with a maraschino cherry and sprinkles.
steps.content: Top each cupcake with a maraschino cherry and sprinkles. You can also use crushed nuts instead of sprinkles.

steps.title: Refrigerate the cupcakes for 1 hour before serving them.
steps.content: Refrigerate the cupcakes for 1 hour before serving them. [11] X Research source Once again, set the cupcakes down onto the muffin tin, and place the tin back into the fridge. This will allow the ganache to set up. Once the time is up, you can serve the cupcakes!

steps.title: Finished.
steps.content: Finished.
